meanings.definition: gravitases: third person singular present of gravitas
meanings.sent1: She gravitases with such seriousness during important meetings.
meanings.sent2: He always gravitases when discussing matters of great importance.
meanings.sent3: The cat gravitases around the house as if it's the king of the castle.
meanings.sent4: Her determination gravitases through every decision she makes.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's authority gravitases over the classroom, keeping everyone in line.

meanings.sent1: Their gravitases in the room made it feel more serious.
meanings.sent2: The gravitases of the situation weighed heavily on everyone present.
meanings.sent3: The gravitases of the clown's performance was unexpected but entertaining.
meanings.sent4: The gravitases of the mountain peak was breathtaking from afar.
meanings.sent5: The gravitases of the decision lingered in the air, creating tension among the group.
